page.title: 04Warsop Mills.
page.content:
The present mill on the River Meden was built in{1765}on the same site as the one mentioned in the 1086 Domesday records.In earlier days the{mill}was {water}powered,grinding corn for flour. Mining subsidence,affecting the water level of the mill dam,and later a fire caused the mill to fall into disuse. The mill is in use today,powered by electricity.The owners are basically corn merchants storing flour in the building,but some pet food is milled.
On the outskirts of Warsop,beside the B6035 road,is Warsop{windmill.}Built in{1825,}it was originally a stone tower mill with 4 patent sails and an ogee cap,or onion top as it is commonly known.Only the stump remains now,which is derelict.
